vulnerabilities.name: Sensitive Information in HTML Comment
vulnerabilities.description: HTML comment contains potentially sensitive information
vulnerabilities.remediation: Remove sensitive information from HTML comments

vulnerabilities.name: Potential XSS Vector
vulnerabilities.description: Form input 's' could be a vector for XSS attacks
vulnerabilities.evidence: <input class="search-field" id="s_mobile" maxlength="30" name="s" placeholder="Search" type="text"/>
vulnerabilities.remediation: Implement input validation and output encoding

vulnerabilities.name: Potential Information Disclosure
vulnerabilities.description: Sensitive file or directory is accessible: /robots.txt
vulnerabilities.remediation: Restrict access to sensitive files and directories

vulnerabilities.name: Potential Information Disclosure
vulnerabilities.description: Sensitive file or directory is accessible: /sitemap.xml
vulnerabilities.remediation: Restrict access to sensitive files and directories

vulnerabilities.name: Version Information Disclosure
vulnerabilities.description: The server is disclosing version information through HTTP headers
vulnerabilities.remediation: Configure the server to not disclose version information
